Title:
Characterization Botryosphaeria dothidea, the Causal Agent of
Grapevine Canker in China
Abstract:
Grapevine canker caused by Botryosphaeria dothidea is
currently one of most important trunk diseases in China. This study
identified the pathogen that causes grapevine canker in most grapevine
culture areas of China and verified the pathogenicity and geographical
distribution of isolates. In total, 320 disease samples were collected
from 17 provinces between 2009 and 2011, and 4261 isolates were purified
from disease samples. Of these, 1172 isolates purified from 150 samples
were identified as B. dothidea by morphological and molecular
characterizations. Three representative isolates were used to determine
optimal temperature and optimal nutrition medium trail. Isolate
pathogenicity was determined for 25 grapevine cultivars. The results
showed that grapevine canker caused by B. dothidea commonly occurred and
that most of the main grapevine cultivars in China are susceptible to
the pathogen.
